subject: JUnit tests and System.in
msgSnippet: I write JUnit tests for classes that were not written by me. If one of these classes happens to include reading from System.in, Eclipse will just hang up and I
messageBody:
I write JUnit tests for classes that were not written by me. If one of
these classes happens to include reading from System.in, Eclipse will
just hang up and I have to kill it.

How can I simulate input on System.in in my test case so that the test
could succeed?

If this is not possible, how can I make it throw an exception instead
of hanging up, so that the test case will just fail?

TIA,
Monika.
